questions.question: To mitigate legal risk, what is the most critical distinction a Narcissistic Abuse Recovery Coach must make in their Service Agreement?
options: The guarantee of specific emotional outcomes after 12 weeks
The explicit statement that coaching is not a substitute for licensed mental health therapy or psychiatric care
A clause stating that the coach has 'Privileged Communication' rights identical to an attorney
The requirement that clients must cease all contact with the narcissist to receive services
questions.explanation: To stay within the legal scope of practice, coaches must clearly differentiate their services from licensed therapy. This prevents 'unauthorized practice of medicine/psychology' claims.

questions.question: According to the 'Financial Architecture' lesson, what is the recommended 'Sustainability Margin' for a boutique recovery practice to account for taxes, overhead, and reinvestment?
questions.explanation: A 35-50% profit margin is considered the gold standard for high-level coaching practices to ensure the founder can pay themselves while maintaining operational excellence.

questions.question: When scaling the N.A.R.C. Recovery Method™, which model allows for the highest 'Client-to-Coach Leverage' without sacrificing the integrity of the 4-step repatterning process?
options: Unlimited 1-on-1 'Voxer' access
The Hybrid Group Model (Pre-recorded curriculum + Weekly live Q&A)
Decreasing the length of individual sessions from 60 to 30 minutes
Selling the N.A.R.C. Method™ as a low-ticket eBook only
questions.explanation: The Hybrid Group Model provides the best balance of scalability and efficacy, allowing the coach to serve many clients simultaneously while maintaining the structured N.A.R.C. framework.

questions.question: In 'Ethical Marketing,' why is 'Pain-Point Agitation' discouraged when positioning yourself as a N.A.R.C. Authority?
options: It is too expensive to run ads for
It can re-traumatize potential clients by triggering a C-PTSD flashback during the sales process
It makes the coach look less professional than their competitors
Most social media platforms ban the use of the word 'Narcissist'
questions.explanation: Trauma-informed marketing avoids agitating wounds. Instead, it focuses on the 'Bridge to Recovery' and the future-self state to ensure the client feels safe, not triggered.

questions.question: A 2023 study on coaching operations found that practices utilizing 'Automated Onboarding Workflows' experienced what percentage increase in client 'First-Week Satisfaction' scores?
questions.explanation: As noted in Lesson 5, automation in the first 72 hours (onboarding) leads to a 27% increase in satisfaction by reducing client anxiety and providing immediate structure.

questions.question: When building a recovery team, what is the recommended 'Supervision Ratio' for Associate Coaches to ensure clinical-grade safety?
options: 1 hour of supervision for every 10 client hours
1 hour of supervision for every 40 client hours
One group meeting per month is sufficient
Supervision is only required if a client files a complaint
questions.explanation: A 1:10 ratio (1 hour of supervision per 10 client hours) is the industry standard for maintaining high ethical standards and preventing secondary traumatic stress in staff.

questions.question: In the 'Crisis Management' framework, what is the 'Golden Hour' protocol regarding a data breach of sensitive client session notes?
options: Wait 72 hours to see if the data is recovered
Immediately notify all affected clients and legal counsel within 24 hours
Delete all remaining files and hope for the best
Only notify clients if their financial information was stolen
questions.explanation: Ethical and legal guidelines (including GDPR/HIPAA standards mentioned in Lesson 7) require rapid notification to mitigate further harm to the client's privacy.

questions.question: Which of the following is a symptom of the 'Founder’s Trap' in a growing recovery business?
options: The business can run for 30 days without the founder's involvement
The founder spends 80% of their time on vision and 20% on operations
Revenue plateaus because the founder is the only person qualified to deliver the 'Core Method'
The founder has successfully licensed their method to other practitioners
questions.explanation: The Founder's Trap occurs when the business cannot scale because the founder is the sole 'bottleneck' for service delivery and decision-making.

questions.question: Case Study: Coach 'A' transitions from charging $150/hour to a $5,000 12-week N.A.R.C. Transformation Package. What is the primary operational benefit of this 'Value-Based' shift?
options: It allows the coach to see 40 clients per week
It reduces 'Client Churn' by attracting high-commitment individuals and funding better support systems
It eliminates the need for a legal contract
It makes the coach immune to local taxes
questions.explanation: High-ticket, value-based pricing increases client 'skin in the game' (commitment) and provides the capital necessary to build robust support systems for those clients.

questions.question: What is the primary purpose of a 'Business Continuity Plan' in a Narcissistic Abuse Recovery practice?
options: To ensure the coach never has to retire
To provide a roadmap for the practice to remain operational during personal illness, emergencies, or tech failures
To automate the process of finding new leads on social media
To guarantee the coach will be mentioned in major news outlets
questions.explanation: Continuity plans ensure that vulnerable clients are not abandoned and the business survives unforeseen disruptions, protecting both the clients and the founder's legacy.
